p: The level of household income has been associated with the presence of mental disorders in some studies, while other studies have shown no association. A reduction of household income is associated with an increased risk for incident mental disorders ( 17). In our study, the monthly income of the participants was correlated with the intensity of the signs of psychological disorders: 38.1% of the participants who described the intensity of their signs of psychological disorder as “often” were from the lowest monthly income group while this percentage had an inverse relationship with the increase in monthly income.
